intro: Micromeria × intermedia, commonly known as the hybrid shrub, is a species native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, branched growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in the spring. Micromeria × intermedia is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy addition to xeriscaped gardens.
